. Financing costs are a significant barrier in developing countries
and growth there depends on access to low
CSP costs have also fallen, albeit at about half the rate of PV:
for CSP are now competitive with more expensive fossil fuels, although the average CSP cost is above
the fossil range. Other data source
s put recent CSP costs at USD 120 MWh
, in the middle of the fossil
. Continuing the pace of change since AR5 will make CSP competitive
with fossil fuels in sunny locations, although it will be difficult for CSP to compete with PV and even
battery systems. CSP electricity can be more valuab
le, however, because CSP systems can
store heat longer than PV battery systems.
Levelized costs of electricity (LCOE) of solar energy technologies 2000
fuel LCOE indicated as dashed lines USD 50
. Linear fit lines were applied to data for AR4
The blue area shows the range between the
th percentile in each year. Data:
The share of total costs of PV
intensive electricity systems attributed to integration costs has been
increasing but can be reduced by enhancing grid flexibility (Section 6.4.3, 6.6,
). The total costs of PV include grid integratio
n, which varies tremendously depending on
PV's share of electricity, other supply sources like wind, availability of storage, transmission capacity,
including grid reinforcement, voltage balancing and control, and impacts
r range of integration costs from USD 2
(Hirth et al. 2015; Wu et al. 2015; Gorman et
, while a comprehensive study put the
for up to 35% renewables and USD 25
sed system flexibility can reduce integration costs of solar energy
, and increase complementarity between wind and solar
Since solar PV panels have very low
operating costs, they can, at high penetrations and in the absence
of adequate incentives to shift demand, depress prices
in wholesale electricity markets, making it
difficult to recoup investment and potentially reducing incentives for new installations
. Continued cost reductions help address this issue of value deflation, but only
partially. Comprehensive solutions depend on adding t
more fundamentally, adjustments to electricity market design
